body_html:
@gmichaeljaison
I tried the proposed solution for MonitoredTrainingSession and it did not work. I got an error message asking me to pass a feed_dict for the handle placeholder when trying
handle_train, handle_val = sess.run([iter_train_handle, iter_val_handle])
I tried passing it an empty string with
feed_dict={handle:''}
and that got me the following error:

InvalidArgumentError (see above for traceback): Trying to access resource located in device from device /job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/cpu:0
[[Node: IteratorFromStringHandle = IteratorFromStringHandle_device="/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/cpu:0"]]

The only thing that worked (from above, no idea why...) was to replace the above line with:
mon_sess._coordinated_creator.tf_sess.run([iter_train_handle, iter_val_handle])

body:
@gmichaeljaison 
I tried the proposed solution for MonitoredTrainingSession and it did not work. I got an error message asking me to pass a feed_dict for the handle placeholder when trying
`handle_train, handle_val = sess.run([iter_train_handle, iter_val_handle])`
I tried passing  it an empty string with 
`feed_dict={handle:''}`
and that got me the following error:

> InvalidArgumentError (see above for traceback): Trying to access resource located in device  from device /job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/cpu:0
         [[Node: IteratorFromStringHandle = IteratorFromStringHandle[_device="/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/cpu:0"](_arg_Placeholder_0_1)]]

The only thing that worked (from above, no idea why...) was to replace the above line with:
`mon_sess._coordinated_creator.tf_sess.run([iter_train_handle, iter_val_handle])`
